questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. Your company's information technology department already ingested a CSV file with column names in the first row into audience insights. You are asked to clean and transform the data to get it ready for unification.
What can you do to satisfy the requirements?
Solution: Clean the data by transforming the first row to be used as headers, defining column types to be appropriate field types, and naming the query. Create a full name column if it does not exist by merging the columns for the first name and last name. Click `Next` and your data is now ready for unification.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think it should be no, because of the full name is not necessarily

Selected Answer: B
No requirement for full name.

Selected Answer: B
No requirement for full name.
it should be No.
why do I need a full name column?

Selected Answer: A
Correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct
C is Correct
Correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/relationships#non-editable-system-relationships

questions.question_text:
You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. Your information technology (IT) team created the customer profile records by unifying the Account, Contact, and
Web Account tables. After unification was complete, the team noticed that three relationships were created automatically (CustomerToContact,
CustomerToAccount and CustomerToWebAccount). The team needs to know how they can configure and update these three relationships.
What feedback should you provide?

choices.C: You cannot edit any of the three relationships, as they are non-editable system relationships.
choices.D: Relationships created via the unification process can only be edited by those with administrator-level access.
choices.A: Relationships created via the unification process can be edited by those with contributor-level access.
choices.B: You can edit each of the three relationships by clicking into the Relationship tab and selecting edit.

discussion.content: C is the right answer. will this be corrected on the actual exam?

Selected Answer: C
Isn't it C?

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer
C is correct

questions.question_text:
You have administrator rights in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights. You completed the map-match-merge phases in the data unification process.

You need to perform the next step to view the unified customer profiles.

What should you configure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Correct
Correct

Selected Answer: BC
Correct. 
A. Is not true
B. True
C. True
D. False. Only admin security role users can configure the search and filter index

choices.B: The only fields that are available for indexing are the ones that exist in the customer profile that you created during the data unification process.
choices.A: You can add up to 25 custom fields to index and configure filtering for each one of the fields as an administrator.
choices.D: Users with a contributor role can add fields on the search and filter index page in audience insights and configure how many filtered records to show.
choices.C: You can only add a filter for a specific field from the search and filter index page in audience insights.

questions.question_text:
You are a Customer Data Platform Specialist. Audience insights users state that they are not able to quickly find details on specific customers while searching customer profiles. You explain the index and search capabilities within audience insights.
Which two statements are correct about configuring and using search and filter index capabilities? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Identify rules for duplication between different entities.
choices.C: Identify the entities that you need to unify into a single profile.
choices.B: Identify the prioritization of similar fields between different entities.
choices.E: Identify the primary keys and semantic field types within the different entities.
choices.A: Select the fields you want to include in the unified customer profile.

questions.question_text:
You are implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights at a bank.

You finish setting up the different initial data sources, and start the unification process.

Which three tasks do you need to perform on the Source fields page during the unification process? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
ACE is correct. You don't do anything with deduplication on the Source Fields page, so D is incorrect.

Selected Answer: ACE
ACE is correct
Must be A C E, duplication (answer D) will be done on the "Duplicate records" page
